message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.IT. 

The paper discusses the efficient learning of Restricted Boltzmann Machines (RBMs), which is a popular topic in machine learning and artificial intelligence. The use of covariance estimates and Hessian matrices suggests a focus on optimization and numerical methods, which are common in the subfield of machine learning. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are the most likely sub-categories. The use of RBMs in computer vision (cs.CV) and neural networks (cs.NE) also suggests these sub-categories as likely possibilities. Finally, the mention of adaptive learning rates and optimization criteria suggests a possible connection to information theory (cs.IT).
